intro: Calycolpus goetheanus, commonly known as the Goethe's sarsaparilla, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
